sen.j: 桂園時代（けいえんじだい/けいおんじだい）とは、大日本帝国陸軍・山縣有朋閥に属する桂太郎と、伊藤博文の後継者として立憲政友会総裁に就いた西園寺公望が、政権を交互に担当した1905年から1912年の8年間をいう。
sen.e: Kei-En era or Kei-On era is the 8 years from 1905 to 1912 in which Taro KATSURA who belonged to the faction led by Aritomo YAMAGATA of the Imperial Japanese Army and Kinmochi SAIONJI who assumed the position of president of Rikken seiyukai (a political party) as a successor of Hirobumi ITO gained power alternately.

Kei-En era (or Kei-On era) was the 8-year period from 1905 to 1912 during which Taro KATSURA, who belonged to the faction led by Aritomo YAMAGATA of the Imperial Japanese Army, and Kinmochi SAIONJI, who assumed the position of president of Rikken seiyukai (a political party) as a successor of Hirobumi ITO, gained power alternately.
sen.cmt: 「8年間」を期間、と考えて 8-year period とし、関係詞の前の前置詞も during としました。
sen.e: Kei-En era (or Kei-On era) was the 8-year period from 1905 to 1912 during which Taro KATSURA, who belonged to the faction led by Aritomo YAMAGATA of the Imperial Japanese Army, and Kinmochi SAIONJI, who assumed the position of president of Rikken seiyukai (a political party) as a successor of Hirobumi ITO, gained power alternately.

sen.j: 「桂園」とは、両者の名前から「桂」と「園」の字をとったものである。
sen.e: Kei-En' means initials of the two in kanji (Chinese characters).
Kei-En' (桂園) was the combination of Kanji (Chinese characters) '桂' and '園' contained in their names.
sen.cmt: 「字をとったもの」を「漢字の組合せ」と考えて、the combination of kanji としました。
sen.e: Kei-En' (桂園) was the combination of Kanji (Chinese characters) '桂' and '園' contained in their names.

sen.j: 桂園時代は、桂に代表される官僚・軍部と西園寺に代表される有力政党である立憲政友会が「情意投合」と呼ばれる連携体制を組んで交互に内閣総理大臣に就任した（この間にも松方正義や山本権兵衛、平田東助などを首相に擁する動きはあったものの、両者以上の政権基盤を持たずにいずれも断念に追い込まれている）。
sen.e: In the Kei-En era, bureaucrats and military typified by Katsura and a leading political party Rikken seiyukai typified by Saionji built a collaborative system called 'emotional agreement' and they alternately served as the prime minister (In the meantime, there was a move to field Masayoshi MATSUKATA, Gonbei YAMAMOTO and Tosuke HIRATA as prime minister, but neither of them had foundations of administration above the two and forced to give up).

In the Kei-En era, bureaucrats and military typified by Katsura and a leading political party Rikken seiyukai typified by Saionji built a collaborative system called 'emotional agreement' and they alternately served as the prime minister (In the meantime, there was a move to field Masayoshi MATSUKATA, Gonbei YAMAMOTO and Tosuke HIRATA as prime minister, but none of them had stronger foundations of administration than those of the two, so they were forced to give up).
sen.cmt: 「松方正義や山本権兵衛、平田東助」と二人以上なので、 neither ではなく none にしました。「追い込まれている」と、受動態なので were を加えました。
sen.e: In the Kei-En era, bureaucrats and military typified by Katsura and a leading political party Rikken seiyukai typified by Saionji built a collaborative system called 'emotional agreement' and they alternately served as the prime minister (In the meantime, there was a move to field Masayoshi MATSUKATA, Gonbei YAMAMOTO and Tosuke HIRATA as prime minister, but none of them had stronger foundations of administration than those of the two, so they were forced to give up).

sen.j: 特に政治的に安定した時期とされ、期間中に行われた第10回衆議院議員総選挙、第11回衆議院議員総選挙は、いずれも任期満了に伴うものである。
sen.e: This era is said to have been politically stable, both the 10th general election of members of the House of Representatives and the 11th general election of members of the House of Representatives were held at the expiration of terms of office.

This era is said to have been politically stable, and both the 10th general election of members of the House of Representatives and the 11th general election of members of the House of Representatives were held at the expiration of terms of office during this period.
sen.cmt: stable までの節と both 以下の節を繫げる接続詞を加え、「期間中に」の訳を加えました。
sen.e: This era is said to have been politically stable, and both the 10th general election of members of the House of Representatives and the 11th general election of members of the House of Representatives were held at the expiration of terms of office during this period.

sen.j: 2回連続で任期満了・総選挙が行われたのは、日本憲政史上においてこの時代だけである。
sen.e: Only in this era, general elections at the expiration of terms of office were held twice in a row in the history of Japanese constitutional government.
Only in this era, general elections at the expiration of terms of office were held twice in a row in the history of Japanese constitutional government.
Only in this era, general elections at the expiration of terms of office were held twice in a row in the history of Japanese constitutional government.

sen.j: なお、「桂園」は和歌の流派名（桂園派。江戸時代後期の歌人、香川景樹が創始した。香川の号が桂園）とも係っている。
sen.e: In addition, the word 'Kei-En' has an another meaning, a name of a school of waka poetry (the Keien school Kageki KAGAWA who was a kajin (waka poet) in the late Edo period founded it. Kagawa's title was Keien).

In addition, the word 'Kei-En' has an another meaning, a name of a school of waka poetry. (the Keien school founded by Kageki KAGAWA, who was a kajin (waka poet) in the late Edo period. Keien was Kagawa's pseudonym.)
sen.cmt: 「号」はこの場合「筆号」なので pseudonym の方がわかりやすく思い、変えました。先行詞が固有名詞なので非制限用法の関係代名詞 who の前にカンマをいれてまとめました。
sen.e: In addition, the word 'Kei-En' has an another meaning, a name of a school of waka poetry. (the Keien school founded by Kageki KAGAWA, who was a kajin (waka poet) in the late Edo period. Keien was Kagawa's pseudonym.)

sen.j: 桂園派は、当時流行しつつあった冒険的な近代短歌に対して、当たり障りのない『古今和歌集』などの伝統を重んじる保守的な流派である。
sen.e: The Keien school was a conservative school which highly regarded tradition such as innocuous "Kokin Wakashu" (A Collection of Ancient and Modern Japanese Poetry) against venturous modern tanka which was coming into fashion at that time.

The Keien school was a conservative school which valued tradition such as innocuous "Kokin Wakashu" (A Collection of Ancient and Modern Japanese Poetry) against venturous modern tanka which was coming into fashion at that time.
sen.cmt: 「重んじる」を value にしました。
sen.e: The Keien school was a conservative school which valued tradition such as innocuous "Kokin Wakashu" (A Collection of Ancient and Modern Japanese Poetry) against venturous modern tanka which was coming into fashion at that time.

sen.j: その当たり障りのなさと、桂・西園寺間の馴れ合いをかけて、これを桂園時代と呼んだもの。
sen.e: Relating its innocuousness to the cozy relationship between Katsura and Saionji, the Kei-En era was named.
Relating its innocuousness to the cozy relationship between Katsura and Saionji, the period was named Kei-En era.
sen.cmt: 「桂園時代と呼んだ」では、桂園時代は補語になり、受動態の主語にならないので変えました。
sen.e: Relating its innocuousness to the cozy relationship between Katsura and Saionji, the period was named Kei-En era.
